define: Named set of characters that a character is a part of. It can be part of more than one set.
A set in which a unique number (aka code point) is assigned to each character.
alt name for coded character set

Way the character is stored in memory. A character set can use more than one encoding. An encoding is associated to only one character set. Different encodings may use same code point to represent different characters.
Font the character is supported in.
A combination of a character encoding and a sort order for the characters
There may be more than one sort order for each character set. Like a case sensitive order and a case insensitive order. Two languages may sort the same characters in a different order.
